S.TRANSL: ‘Then let me tell you a story.’
‘They say a priest, in a village, in a tiny village.’

S.FORM: yānī eme dēy kēm pē dełēyn köredē
S.TRANSL: ‘That’s we call a small village a “köredē” [lit. blind village].’

S.FORM: lew köredēyey herčend deykird be berātekey xoy be ře nedečū
S.TRANSL: ‘In this tiny village, whatever he did he was not able to make a living with his earning.’

S.FORM: yānī be huqūqekey xoy be ře nedečū
S.TRANSL: ‘That’s he could not make a living with his salary.’

S.FORM: herčend fikrī lē dekirdewe hīč fāydeyī nebū
S.TRANSL: No matter how much he thought about it, there was no use of it.
A carpenter was also there (in the village).

S.FORM: nejāřekeš kutī kuře jā ewe emin čāwim le kāk miħemedī bē
S.TRANSL: ‘The carpenter said: Man, if I am to wait for Mr. Muhammed,’
‘(until) his plough breaks up.’
‘You know what an “amur” is, don't you?’
‘That with which the ox ploughs.’

S.FORM: dā_xwā āyā de řožē dā emin āmūrēkī hełbestim
S.TRANSL: ‘How come whether I repair one plough a day,’
‘I cannot make a living by this.’
‘There was also a tailor.’

S.FORM: xeyāteke, hersēkyān kewtine kin ēk, hersēkyān
S.TRANSL: ‘The tailor, all three gathered together [lit. fell next to each other]’

S.FORM: kutī eme tedbīrēkī bo xomān bikeyn
S.TRANSL: ‘He said, we shall take mesures for ourselves.’

S.FORM: xo eto ne bew berāte be ře dečī
S.TRANSL: ‘It is clear that you cannot make a living with this earning (of yours),’

S.FORM: ne emin bew xeyātīye be ře dečim
S.TRANSL: ‘nor do I can make a living with this tailoring,’

S.FORM: ne etož bew nejāřey be ře dečī
S.TRANSL: ‘nor can you make a living with this carpentry.’
‘He said: What would be fine to do?’

S.FORM: kutī wiłłāhī mil denēyn le qāčāxčīyātīye
S.TRANSL: ‘He said: by God we will set our hands to smuggling.’

S.FORM: yēk dełē qāčāxčī yēk dełē tujāřet
S.TRANSL: ‘One says smuggling, one says trade.’
‘Trade, we should go do trading.’
‘They say, they stood up (and) left.’
‘They did thinggummy.’

S.FORM: āyā her šitēkī we gīrīān kewit yān we gīrīān nekewit
S.TRANSL: ‘Whether they got hold of any thing or they did not get hold of.’
‘They came (and) stayed in a desert.’
Desert, you know what it is?

S.FORM: čolge, yānī hīč kesī lē nebū
S.TRANSL: ‘“čolge”, that’s nobody was there.’
‘It’s dangerous.’

S.FORM: yānī ewe heger dizēk četeyēk dizēk bē
S.TRANSL: ‘That’s if a thief, a bandit, a thief comes over,’
‘these, their life is in danger.’

S.FORM: herj māłēkī pēyān bē lēyān destēnin
S.TRANSL: Whathever be with them, they will usurp.

S.FORM: kutī wā čāke (yēkmān, wr) dūmān binūīn yēkmān nīgābānīē bikēšīn
S.TRANSL: ‘He said: The best is (one of us) two of us sleep one of us guards.’
‘We are four persons in here.’
‘But they were three persons.’

S.FORM: yēkyān kutī emin dū sāʕetān nīgābānī dekēšim engo binūn
S.TRANSL: ‘One of them said: I shall guard for two hours (and) you sleep,’

S.FORM: ewī dīkeyān kutī dūwāyā emin hestēne
S.TRANSL: ‘the other one of them said: then wake me up.’

S.FORM: ewī dīkeš kutī dūwāyā emin hestēne
S.TRANSL: ‘The other also said: later on wake me up.’
‘They became three shifts.’
‘Let me tell you, the turn of the carpenter came.’
‘The turn of the carpenter came (and)’

S.FORM: kuře kutī emin ege āwā dānīšim xewim dē
S.TRANSL: ‘he said: if I sit like this I may fall asleep.’
‘He set out (and) found out a tree trunk.’

S.FORM: lew dārey yēk ʕīnsānī durust kird, ʕīnsān
S.TRANSL: ‘Out of this tree, he built a human being, human being.’
‘When he built the human being,’
‘his time was completed.’
‘That is, the time of his guard was completed.’
‘When the time of his guard was completed,’
‘“Suleiman, wake up it's your turn.”’
‘when Suleiman woke up, he was the tailor.’

S.FORM: bełē biřēkī hetā dim ū čāwī hestiřīyewe xewī lē řewī w
S.TRANSL: ‘by God, for a while he rubbed his face so that his sleep was away and’
‘for a while he washed his face [lit. mouth and eyes].’

S.FORM: ege temāšāy kird spīyāyēk ho lewendey dīyāre
S.TRANSL: ‘When he looked, (he saw that) a whiteness is visible down there.’

S.FORM: ey kuře kutī ew spīyāe debēt či bē
S.TRANSL: ‘Man, he said: what can this whiteness be?’
‘When he went forward (towards) it.’
‘He looked (and saw that) this is a tree trunk,’
‘the carpenter has built it.’

S.FORM: kutī ne nejāř ewey boyā durus kirdūwe
S.TRANSL: ‘He said: No, the carpenter has built it for that’
‘so that he would fall asleep.’
‘(that) the sleep does not grasp him.’

S.FORM: eminīš dēnim lew bergāney lew pārčāney hemāne
S.TRANSL: ‘As for me, I will bring, out of those clothes, out of those fabrics (that) we have’

S.FORM: lew pārčāne yek bergī bo durus dekem
S.TRANSL: ‘out of those fabrics, I will sew a garment for it.’
‘Like a human being may it stand there.’
‘He said: That’s very nice.’

S.FORM: ewīš eger ew bergey bo durū w de berī kird
S.TRANSL: ‘When he also sew that garment for it and put on it’
‘He also, his time was up.’
‘He said: “O priest, wake up, it’s your turn”.’
‘They say, when he woke up (and) it was his turn,’

S.FORM: ewīš ege ā āwā temāšāy kird
S.TRANSL: ‘He too, when he looked like this to it,’
‘(he said:) God, that visible blackness’
‘No matter how much he said: Who are you who are you?’
‘It was without a soul anyway.’

S.FORM: kutī eto či kesī bo jūwāb nādeyewe?
S.TRANSL: ‘He said: What a person are you? Why do not you answer?’
‘The tree trunk fell down on earth.’

S.FORM: kutī ne ewe kārī nejāř ū kārī xeyātīye
S.TRANSL: ‘He said: No, this is the work of the carpenter and the work of the tailor.’
‘As for me, I shall perform an ablution,’
‘pray two rakahs of salat,’
‘I shall implore at God,’
‘I will read Qoran for a while,’
‘(so that) I hope (that) God has mercy on us,’
‘(and) the soul enters into it.’
‘Well, he said: that's very nice.’
‘He took these measures.’

S.FORM: be ħimrī ew xudāyey řuħī we ber hāt
S.TRANSL: ‘With the order of this God, the soul entered into it.’
‘This which is a story of ancestors,’
‘that means if you are decent, that's how it is.’
‘Well you in this case,’

S.FORM: eto ew kulkedāre bote ħāfretēk deydey be kīhāyān?
S.TRANSL: ‘you, (now that) this tree trunk has turned into a woman, you give her to which one of them?’
‘You give her to which one of them?’

S.FORM: deydey be melāyī deydey be xeyātī deydey be nejāřī?
S.TRANSL: ‘You give her to the priest, you give her to the tailor, you give her to the carpenter?’
‘I am asking you!’
‘(The interviewer): it's the priest's right.’
‘That’s correct.’
